chapter.title: The libdhcp++ Library
chapter.para:
libdhcp++ is a library written in C++ that handles many DHCP-related tasks, including:
DHCPv4 and DHCPv6 packets parsing, manipulation, and assembly
Option parsing, manipulation, and assembly
Network interface detection
Socket operations such as creation, data transmission and reception, and socket closing.
While this library is currently used by Kea, it is designed to be a portable, universal library, useful for any DHCP-related software.

section.title: Interface Detection and Socket Handling
section.para: Both the DHCPv4 and DHCPv6 components share network interface detection routines. Interface detection is currently supported on Linux, all BSD family (FreeBSD, NetBSD, OpenBSD), Mac OS X, and Solaris 11 systems.

DHCPv4 requires special raw-socket processing to send and receive packets from hosts that do not have an IPv4 address assigned. Support for this operation is implemented on Linux, FreeBSD, NetBSD, and OpenBSD. It is likely that the DHCPv4 component will not work in certain cases on other systems.
